alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:44AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wichita and southeastern Greeley Counties through 1215 AM MDT/115 AM CDT/... At 1143 PM MDT/1243 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Tribune, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Wichita and southeastern Greeley Counties, including the following locations... Marienthal, Lydia and Selkirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
